title: The Five Nine: Telecom takes a quantum leap
summary: You’ve probably heard about quantum technology in news headlines, but what is it and what does it really mean for telcos? Fierce’s Masha Abarinova sits down with Orange Business and Qunnect to find out.

title: AT&T marks latest open RAN achievement with Ericsson, 1Finity
summary: AT&T achieved a milestone in open RAN by completing the first open RAN call using third-party radios from Ericsson and Fujitsu’s 1Finity subsidiary on its commercial network.

title: Opinion: Stop grumbling about open RAN not going your way
summary: Recent announcements by Vodafone and its vendors show open RAN is accomplishing exactly what the operators asked for.

title: Agentic AI: Why telcos will be the architects of industry transformation (Reader Forum)
summary: Telcos have a tremendous opportunity to lead the AI economy Telcos are no longer just connecting people. They are orchestrating intelligent, end-to-end experiences that are reshaping entire industries. At the heart of this transformation is agentic AI — autonomous, context-aware systems that sense, decide, and act with minimal human input. This evolution is not theoretical, […]

title: Applied Digital pens $5B AI factory lease with unnamed hyperscaler
summary: This week, Applied Digital announced it secured a 15-year, $5 billion contract for 200 MW of capacity at its Polaris Forge 2 facility in North Dakota.

title: Which will lead AI growth wave, AT&T, T-Mobile US, or Verizon? (Analyst Angle)
summary: Verizon and T-Mobile US announced new CEOs — will AT&T? The world of telecom and wireless investment has undergone significant changes. title: MasOrange achieves merger synergies of $301m in Jan-Sep
summary: During the January-September period, MasOrange said its total revenues rose 3.7% year-on-year to €5.66 billion In sum – what to know: €259M in synergies achieved – MasOrange captured more than half its €500 million synergy goal within nine months, ahead of schedule for 2025. Profits and cash flow rise – Revenue grew 3.7% to €5.66 […]

title: How 5G is powering the next chapter in federal IT modernization (Reader Forum)
summary: 5G supports real-time decision-making, cloud and edge adoption, and cyber readiness across mobile operations Today, 4G LTE remains the dominant wireless communication standard across most federal agencies. It’s the backbone for mobile connectivity; supporting field communications, basic data transfers, and secure access to cloud platforms. Many agencies still rely heavily on 4G for daily operations, […]

title: Samsung Electronics, SoftBank ink AI-RAN collaboration
summary: Samsung noted that the agreement outlines four focus areas: 6G, AI for RAN, AI and RAN, and Large Telecom Model In sum – what to know: Samsung and SoftBank sign MoU – The pair will collaborate on 6G, AI-RAN, and Large Telecom Model (LTM) research to advance next-generation communications technologies. title: Five states making real progress on BEAD
summary: As most states finalize their broadband expansion plans, a few are standing out for their speed, strategy, and scope In sum – what to know: States push ahead – Louisiana, Texas, Hawaii, Mississippi, and Nevada are turning BEAD plans into action amid shifting federal rules. Fiber still leads, for now – Most states remain fiber-first, […]

title: ZTE wins “Best Indoor Connectivity Solution” award at Network X 2025
summary: ZTE Corporation has been recognized with the “Best Indoor Connectivity Solution” award for its Full-Scenario Indoor Digitalization Solution at Network X 2025 in Paris. The recent recognition underscores ZTE’s leadership in indoor network innovation during the 5G and 5G-Advanced (5G-A) era, highlighting its technological strength and scenario-based approach to enabling green, efficient, and high-performance connectivity […]

title: Investment firm to take 80% stake in Meta's Hyperion data center
summary: Asset manager Blue Owl Capital has agreed to fund 80% of Meta's $27-billion Hyperion data center development.

title: AT&T snaps back at T-Mobile with new ad
summary: This week, AT&T launched a new advertising campaign aimed at squashing “T-Mobile’s untruths” while championing AT&T’s network.

title: Celona's private network deal with EchoStar's Hughes will open new opportunities
summary: The deal will see the pair working together in the United States and likely further afield.

title: AT&T calls out the high cost of copper theft
summary: AT&T EVP Rhonda Johnson estimated the operator has spent over $60 million to repair damage from copper theft and network vandalism.

title: T-Mobile US delivers record customer growth amid rising capex
summary: T-Mobile US COO and incoming CEO Srini Gopalan said the carrier had its ‘best Q3 in over a decade’ In sum – what to know: Subscriber growth surges: T-Mobile added a record 2.35 million postpaid customers in Q3 2025 — including 1 million postpaid phone lines — cementing its lead in U.S. wireless growth. title: Global 5G FWA to reach 150mn subscriptions by 2030: Omdia
summary: The research identifies FWA as the world’s fastest-growing broadband technology, driven by rapid adoption in India and the US In sum – what to know: Global momentum builds – 5G FWA subscriptions will hit 150 million by 2030, accounting for nearly 90% of all FWA connections. summary: Traditional DAS solutions can be costly, complex, and slow to deploy. There is a better way. Join SureCall and RCR Wireless News for a live webinar exploring how hybrid DAS is transforming enterprise cellular solutions— delivering carrier-grade performance without the expense and complications of active DAS. title: TAFS selects Ciena's optical tech for submarine TAM-1 project
summary: Trans Americas Fiber System will use Ciena's high-capacity optical technology in its undersea TAM-1 project, which will connect North and South America with 650 Tbps of capacity.

title: Versa integrates its SD-WAN with Microsoft Entra
summary: Versa this week announced it is partnering with Microsoft to offer an automated integration of their SD-WAN and Microsoft Entra as a "comprehensive SASE solution."

title: Nokia sees mobile networks stabilizing, as it reports sales up 12% in Q3
summary: Nokia's CEO talked about how to move its mobile RAN business forward on the Q3 call Thursday.

title: Opinion: AWS’s avoidable cloud outage highlights a bigger problem
summary: Hyperscalers don’t have to follow the same critical infrastructure rules as carriers – and they don’t.

title: China’s HiCloud goes under the sea with new data center
summary: The company is starting with a 24 MW facility off the coast of Shanghai but said it plans to scale up – way up.

title: Amphenol eyes more M&A growth as CommScope deal nears
summary: As Amphenol closes in on CommScope, CEO Adam Norwitt said it’s eyeing more M&A opportunities in the “highly fragmented” interconnect market.

title: T-Mobile CEO's last call: Ending Q3 on a high note
summary: T-Mobile posted another stellar quarter: 1 million new postpaid phone customers, 506,000 fixed wireless access (FWA) subscribers and fiber net customer additions of 54,000.

title: AT&T's CEO says convergence is key for Ma Bell
summary: Talking on the operator's Q3 call, Stankey covered a bunch of topics from EchoStar to LEO satellites.

title: Lynk, Omnispace to merge in drive to grow D2D
summary: In an attempt to speed their efforts in the direct-to-device (D2D) satellite cell phone market, Lynk Global and Omnispace are merging, with SES becoming a major strategic shareholder.

title: Charter plans 1,200 new job cuts following its Cox deal
summary: Sources told the WSJ Charter will lay off 1,200 corporate roles – just over 1% of its 95,000-person workforce.

title: Verizon: AI, mobile devices are brewing ‘perfect storm’ for security
summary: Mobile devices are under attack now more than ever, according to the Verizon 2025 Mobile Security Index.

title: More than 20% of BEAD locations will go to satellite
summary: Many people in the fiber industry are disappointed that so many BEAD grants have gone to LEO. But in locations such as Hawaii and Maine, it makes sense.

title: NTT Data keeps on (semi-autonomously) truckin'
summary: The vendor talked to Fierce about its multi-site private network play at MWC last week.

title: Ciena’s optic tech will power new Caribbean subsea cable
summary: Trans Americas Fiber System will use Ciena coherent optics to deploy a new 650 Tbps-capable subsea cable route.

title: Opinion: Verizon needs new CEO Dan Schulman to pull it out of the doldrums
summary: Verizon's been in the dumps for a while. Now it's up to new CEO Dan Schulman to pick up the pieces and put Verizon back together again.

title: Fierce Network’s 2025 telecom and tech layoff tracker — Charter to cut 1,200 jobs
summary: Slice and dice is only good when it comes to food. Here's how many workers Amazon, AT&T, IBM, Meta, Microsoft, Verizon and more are shedding this year.
